SENIOR MANAGER/SPECIALIST LEADER HEALTHCARE
Executive Profile
Seasoned Health Care Leader and clinician with deep operations
experiences spanning multiple markets and health care delivery systems.   Demonstrated ability to lead complex projects
to successful completion, working with multi-disciplinary teams – Executive
Leadership teams, physicians, management and staff/clinicians.  Excellent communication skills, creative
strategic thinker and collaborative team builder.  I have spent the last 18 years serving
leading healthcare organizations across the county, including Mayo Clinic, UMHS and Cedars-Sinai as a Senior Leader with
Deloitte Consulting LLP.  Seeking opportunities
to work with innovative, cutting edge organizations targeting healthcare
transformations.

of clinical transformation efforts, resulting in tangible bottom line financial
benefits

<JD_START>
Job Title: Technical Product Manager

Location: Nashville, TN

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Health Care Provider, Information Technology

Description:
Description

Introduction

Do you want to join an organization that invests in you as a Technical Product Manager? At HCA Healthcare, you come first. HCA Healthcare has committed up to $300 million in programs to support our incredible team members over the course of three years.

Benefits

HCA Healthcare offers a total rewards package that supports the health, life, career and retirement of our colleagues. The available plans and programs include:

Comprehensive medical coverage that covers many common services at no cost or for a low copay. Plans include prescription drug and behavioral health coverage as well as free telemedicine services and free AirMed medical transportation. Additional options for dental and vision benefits, life and disability coverage, flexible spending accounts, supplemental health protection plans (accident, critical illness, hospital indemnity), auto and home insurance, identity theft protection, legal counseling, long-term care coverage, moving assistance, pet insurance and more. Free counseling services and resources for emotional, physical and financial wellbeing401(k) Plan with a 100% match on 3% to 9% of pay (based on years of service)Employee Stock Purchase Plan with 10% off HCA Healthcare stockFamily support through fertility and family building benefits with Progyny and adoption assistance. Referral services for child, elder and pet care, home and auto repair, event planning and moreConsumer discounts through Abenity and Consumer DiscountsRetirement readiness, rollover assistance services and preferred banking partnershipsEducation assistance (tuition, student loan, certification support, dependent scholarships)Colleague recognition programTime Away From Work Program (paid time off, paid family leave, long- and short-term disability coverage and leaves of absence)Employee Health Assistance Fund that offers free employee-only coverage to full-time and part-time colleagues based on income. 

Learn More About Employee Benefits

Note: Eligibility for benefits may vary by location.

You contribute to our success. Every role has an impact on our patients’ lives and you have the opportunity to make a difference. We are looking for a dedicated Technical Product Manager like you to be a part of our team.

Job Summary And Qualifications

POSITION SUMMARY: The Product Manager will support specific Care Transformation and Innovation products through its maturation process. This role will support the day to day operational needs of the multi-disciplinary CT&I teams’ perspective/requirements while ensuring alignment to strategy to deliver innovative products that meet our transformational objectives. In this role, you will be supporting the product lifecycle of our data science initiatives, from ideation and planning to execution and launch. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams, including data scientists, engineers, designers, and stakeholders, to define product requirements, prioritize features, and drive the development of innovative data-driven products. The ideal candidate is passionate about data science, possesses strong technical and analytical skills, and has a proven track record of successfully managing data science products. In order to ensure systems of control and product standards, this role will be require field level awareness of utilization, enhancements, support, and practical use of all CT&I products.

Key Responsibilities

Support and execute the product strategy and roadmap for our data science initiatives, in alignment with the company's overall vision and goals. Collaborate with stakeholders, including business leaders, data scientists, engineers, and designers, to identify and prioritize product features and requirements. Conduct market research and analysis to identify emerging trends, customer needs, and competitive landscape, and incorporate insights into product planning. Transform business requirements into clear and actionable product specifications, including user stories, wireframes, and prototypes. Support cross-functional teams in the development and delivery of products, ensuring adherence to project timelines and quality standards. Work closely with data scientists and engineers to define data requirements, establish data collection and processing methodologies, and ensure the availability of high-quality data for product development. Monitor and analyze product performance, user feedback, and market trends to identify areas for improvement and inform product iterations. Collaborate with the Change Management and Education teams to develop implementation strategies, product positioning, and marketing collateral to drive product adoption Stay up-to-date with advancements in data science, machine learning, and AI technologies, and proactively identify opportunities to leverage emerging technologies in our products. SQL (2+ years)Python (1+ years)Data analysis experience (2+ years)Familiarity with working in modern software development environment; including git, promotion across environments, user acceptance testing, and release strategiesUnderstanding of data science process; including data ingest, feature engineering, model experimentation, deployment to cloud environment, monitoring practicesTranslating technical concepts to business stakeholdersJob may require up to 25% travel

EDUCATION

Bachelor’s Degree Required Master’s Degree preferred

KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, ABILITIES, BEHAVIORS: REQUIREMENTS

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field such as Business Analytics, Computer Science, Statistics, or a related discipline. Proven experience as a Product Analyst or similar role, preferably in a technology-driven company. Strong analytical skills with the ability to manipulate, interpret, and derive insights from complex data sets. Understanding of data science methodologies, machine learning algorithms, and statistical techniques. Proficient experience and skills developing in the Google Cloud Platform and Google Looker. Proficient in using data analysis tools, programming languages (e.g., Python, R), and data visualization tools. Proficiency in SQL and data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) for data extraction, analysis, and reporting. Familiarity with statistical analysis techniques and experiment design. Excellent communication skills, with the ability to translate complex data insights into actionable recommendations for non-technical stakeholders. Detail-oriented mindset with a strong focus on accuracy and quality of analysis. Self-motivated and able to work independently as well as collaboratively in a fast-paced, dynamic environment. Knowledge of Agile methodologies and experience working in cross-functional teams. 

Outcomes Requirements

Effectiveness of work planning and agile work flowsEfficiency in iterative development to ensure product effectiveness and success Innovation culture with associated behaviors and ways of working is maintained, indicative of a creative spirit but structured work Required

HCA Healthcare (Corporate), based in Nashville, Tennessee, supports a variety of corporate roles from business operations to administrative positions. Like our colleagues in any HCA Healthcare hospital, our corporate campus employees enjoy unparalleled resources and opportunities to reach their potential as healthcare leaders and innovators. From market rate compensation to continuing education and career advancement opportunities, every person has a solid foundation for success. Nashville is also home to our Executive Development Program, where exceptional employees are groomed to take on CNO- and COO-level roles in our hospitals. This selective program focuses on ethics, leadership and the financial and clinical knowledge required of professionals at this level of the industry.

HCA Healthcare has been recognized as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute more than ten times. In recent years, HCA Healthcare spent an estimated $3.7 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

"Good people beget good people."- Dr. Thomas Frist, Sr.

HCA Healthcare Co-Founder

We are a family 270,000 dedicated professionals! Our Talent Acquisition team is reviewing applications for our Technical Product Manager opening. Qualified candidates will be contacted for interviews. Submit your resume today to join our community of caring!

We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

Experience Level (if available): Entry level
<JD_END>
